snippet: For 125 years, the Lee Wilson family owned Wilson, Ark., building a fortune from farming. Its new owner, however, seeks to transform the town into a beacon of art, culture and education.
abstract: Wilson Journal; Wilson, Ark, which was owned for 125 years by farming magnate Lee Wilson and his family, was bought in 2010 by businessman Gaylon Lawrence Jr, who is seeking to transform tiny, backwards town into beacon of art, culture and education in one of poorest regions in state.
lead_paragraph: For 125 years, the Lee Wilson family owned Wilson, Ark., building a fortune from farming. Its new owner, however, seeks to transform the town into a beacon of art, culture and education.

headline.main: Arkansas Town’s New Owner Has Visions of Its Renaissance
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Town’s New Owner Has Visions of Its Renaissance
